description: Lidl is building a new store on the former Three Counties Hotel in Hereford off the Belmont Road.
title: Hereford Lidl signs approved despite 'alien element' concerns
title_page: Hereford Lidl signs approved despite 'alien element' concerns - BBC News
maintext:
New signs on and around Hereford's new Lidl supermarket have been approved â€“ despite claims they would introduce an "alien element" to the mostly residential area.
The store is to be built at the former Three Counties Hotel site, off the A465 Belmont Road southwest of the city.
City councillor Jeremy Milln, acting in a personal capacity, expressed concern over the signs and asked for them not to be lit up.
Herefordshire Council planning officer Heather Carlisle considered that the design and scale of the signs "would sit comfortably in the context of the site and its surroundings".
